column1: #Text=It had already been established [25] that Sc3In forms nonstoichiometrically around the ionic ratio Sc∶In ¼ 3∶1.
#Text=In the current study, we have determined that the optimal composition, which yielded the highest Curie temperature TC and paramagnetic moment μPM, was Sc∶In ¼ 3.1∶1.

#Text=Polycrystalline samples of ðSc1−xLuxÞ 3.1In (0 ≤ x ≤ 0.10) were prepared by arcmelting Sc (Ames Laboratory, 99.999%), Lu (Ames Laboratory, 99.999%) and In (Alfa Aesar, 99.9995%), with mass losses of no more than 0.5%.
#Text=The arcmelted buttons were subsequently wrapped in Ta foil, sealed in quartz tubes under a partial Ar atmosphere, and annealed over two weeks at temperatures between 700 °C and 800 °C.
